main.track: Where I End and You Begin

comments.comment: I barely ever listened to Radiohead before coming out to this show - it was awhile ago - ever since that amazing night - I have been a hard core Radiohead fan. The most soothing, energizing music that speaks not only to my mind but to my heart of hearts lies within their sound for me and I will never forget 08/21/03 when I was first exposed. I have never turned back since.

i have a bootleg of the show if anyone *everyone is interested.) Not only do I have the bootleg on CD but ALSO DVD...Yes fans, I taped the concert *illegally* but it was well worth it...Mail me at rcrizzo@student.ysu.edu for info...
After seeing the show I ask myself why bands like Good Charlote even exist...

I can't believe how great a venue Blossom was: from an acoustical, visual, and energy standpoint. Tom looked to be enjoying himself and smiling - "You want some more?!" - which only lent itself to an amazing experience. If anyone has a copy, I'd love to know about it.

I have seen radiohead for the 2001 Boston show, and I thought nothing could top that...but this was by far the most amazing concert I have ever been to. I really think radiohead is making a huge mark on the shape of music. There is nothing more progressive or revolutionary sonically than this band. Definitely worth the drive from Cincinnati. I just wish I could see them again soon!
By the way... did anyone bootleg this show? (presidainte@hotmail.com)
Breath Taking they put me in a trance like state of mind. tons of energy great lighting and visuals

Stunning display of their talents. Highlight I think was Myxomatosis. Even the slight screw up during Idioteque provided a nice improv by Mr. York. Blossom Music Center is an amazing venue for the Radiohead sound.
WOW! What an amazing show... well worth the 5 hour drive up and back!
